Reviews.Title: Mini-Marvel
Reviews.Author: Stephen R. Berry
Reviews.Content: I have both the white and chrome versions of this teeny-tiny camera. I didn't expect much in terms of image quality, but was very pleasantly surprised at how good the photographs are. It also shoots stabilized 720p high-definition video that looks very good as well! It uses a high quality touch-screen to perform most of the menu selections, but once in shooting mode, the camera makes most of the decisions for you - just frame and shoot to your heart's content.This camera has a built-in non-removable battery, as well as 8GB of built-in non-removable memory. The upside is that you do not need to purchase a separate memory card - this thing is ready to go straight out of the box. The build is very solid for such a tiny camera - it is the smallest camera Nikon has ever made. There is just a single tiny door with a micro-USB port under it on the bottom of the camera that is used to both charge the camera (Nikon includes a wall charger, but you can charge it by plugging it into your computer as well) as well as transfer pictures to your computer. My computer recognized the camera straight away (windows 7) and transferring images was a snap.I HIGHLY recommend this camera for someone like me who wants something teeny-tiny that they can carry around everywhere that also produces reasonable quality images and video.**UPDATE - November 3rd ***A couple of weeks later and I am still thoroughly enjoying this little thing! I think the main thing to bear in mind is that the reason you are buying this camera is because it is TINY and you can have it with you absolutely everywhere.  Nikon obviously had to make trade-offs when making something this small - the main one for me is focusing speed - it is a little slow to gain focus - so you have to bear that in mind. Picture quality is EXCELLENT for such a teeny-tiny camera - as well as video.TIP - as one or two other people have commented, turn off the "touch shutter" function - stabbing the screen with your finger to take a photo will almost certainly produce more blurry photos than just using the shutter button :-)I am more than happy with this purchase - it definitely meets its intended purpose - something absolutely TINY that you can take with you everywhere and grab some pretty good pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: manzana
Reviews.Content: Ask any photographer and they will tell you that the first rule of photography is having the camera with you. This camera is very small, light weight,and really easy to pocket. Also limited menu options means that there is no learning curve.  Downside is a weak flash which frankly is pretty useless (unless you get within 3 feet of your subject), and poor depth of field which limits sharpness on those landscape shots. These negatives aside, I just took it for a weeks vacation to New Mexico, and was pleasantly surprised by picture quality. Since the camera is pretty much a point and shoot automatic, you find yourself concentrating on framing the picture which in many respects helps produce better shots. It also has exposure compensation which is helpful in both low and bright light. I certainly think this camera is a better option than the camera on my smart phone. The touch screen works, but to limit camera shake I suggest using the shutter.  All and all I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: R. V.
Reviews.Content: I bought this little camera for both myself and my sister.  It's fast to start up,  and so simple.  I own another Nikon and this little camera takes less time from on to taking a photo.  Took a photo of my indoors Christmas lights with no flash and no additional lighting and the photo came out fantastic.  Deleting is so simple, just press on the photo and the delete/favorite screen comes up.  Love,  love,  LOVE it's simplicity.  Don't have to concern myself with settings, it's automatic, even the flash.  Being able to take photos by either touching the screen or shutter button is a plus.  Basically, right out of the box and I was taking photos.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: mooranda
Reviews.Content: bought this camera 3 days ago and love it !! so easy to use and the size is perfect . I bought mine to take with me to vegas and not be lugging around my nikon s8200 ,taking pictures is a snap and the quality isnt half bad for what the camera has to offer .

Reviews.Title: Cute and HUgely Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Vance Marshall
Reviews.Content: Lets start out with what Nikon has done right:The physical design and build quality of this camera are both good.  It's very cute, easily pocketable and the physical buttons are responsive.  Alas, that's where the good news ends.Over the past 8 or 9 years I've bought 15 cameras ranging from point and shoots to a mid range SLR.  Every single one of those cameras, including a 2 megapixel fixed lens Fuji has had better image quality than the S01.  More damning, my Galaxy Nexus has equal or slightly better IQ.This camera has a very poor sensor that takes terrible pictures in low light and bad to middling in good.  Nikon needs to replace this with a CMOS sensor.The touch screen is poor and unresposive.  Often even hard presses do not register.In camera options are minimal.This camera is slow.  Slow to focus, slow to take a shot, slow to change modes.  Everything is slow.  You'll press a virtual button and then wait a second or longer for a result.If you have a smartphone with a halfway decent camera this device becomes redundant.  I was hoping for more and Canon's upcoming N2 might deliver that (for a higher price).  This is a toy more than a camera and a fair price for the results would be $60 or under.

Reviews.Title: The Nikon S01 has a MAJOR problem!
Reviews.Author: RS1
Reviews.Content: I saw this camera in a store and couldn't believe how tiny it was! The pictures it takes are really great! I bought it immediately. There's no removeable SD card or battery, which makes it real easy to maintain.  Uploading to your computer is simple.  This camera is great for scenery, sunsets, but you need to be up-close when taking pictures of people.  The built-in flash works okay, but it doesn't not have a lot of "throw" so you need to be very close to your subject for the best quality.  That's the good news.  Now for the bad:I brought this new camera to Mexico for a two-week vacation over Christmas 2012 and everything was working great, until a day or two before I was to return.  I plugged the cable in to upload some pix to my laptop and the S01 sounded 3 beeps and showed a red exclamation point in a circle, like this: (!), and there was a red, horizontal line 3/4 of the way up the screen.  I couldn't upload anything, couldn't take a picture, and couldn't see any of the pix that I had taken!  Turning it off & on still produced the 3 beeps and red line.  Even though I could access the menu items, I couldn't get the S01 to take a picture or view the pix I had taken!  I checked Nikon's website and there wasn't any troubleshooting that had this issue listed. I called Nikon and the tech I spoke with never heard of this issue and wasn't even that familiar with this camera!  I contacted the store I bought it from (Samy's), and they were great and said for me to bring it back to exchange it.  I thought that this specific S01 may be a lemon. I turned it on again, and it wanted me to format the card, which I knew would result in losing all my pix, which I wasn't ready to try...yet.  I tried a reset, but that didn't do anything to fix it.  I then got so frustrated that I did format the card, received a prompt asking that I wanted to do it, but never received a confirmation that the card was formatted.  I didn't use the camera again and the day I was going to bring it back, I turned it on and it was working and all the pix I took were there!  I immediately tried uploading them, which at first didn't work, but on subsequent tries, did.  Once I uploaded all the pix, I decided I was going to exchange it at the store.  One of the salespeople there said she had a customer the other day with the same issue, exchanged the bad S01 for a new one, and the customer brought the new one back two days later because it was doing the same thing!  So, this is obviously a major issue with this camera but so far, Nikon isn't letting on that they're aware of this issue!  I need to be able to trust the camera I'm using, and at this point, the S01 is not a camera I can trust!I really want to love this camera. I gave it 3 stars because when this camera works, it's wonderful, but until Nikon acknowledges and fixes this issue, Buyer beware!!

Reviews.Title: It Doesn't Get Any Better - For Me!
Reviews.Author: Jeff J.
Reviews.Content: I debated a bit before I bought this little jewel.  After all, there were quite a few 'unflattering' reviews to read.  But, in the end, I decided to give the Nikon S01 a try myself.  I couldn't be happier!  I've not left the house without my S01 in my pocket, and have yet to be the least bit disappointed in the images I've captured.  I read several peoples complaints about slow shutter speed and blurry images, but can honestly say that I've not experienced any of those issues.  Instead, I've found the S01 the perfect partner for my Nikon D90, always handy for the quick shot and excellent for quick videos.  I would recommend that folks make use of the button rather that the touch-screen shutter release (and believe the latter may be the reason for some of the blurry photo comments).  Overall, I love it!

Reviews.Title: A beautiful piece
Reviews.Author: gadgetnut
Reviews.Content: I bought Nikon S01 because I couldn't resist it! It's a very small and cute camera, with the respectability of Nikon brand name!It takes pretty good pictures for its size. I cannot say that it is an outstanding camera by any measure of imagination. But takes nice pictures and is a good conversation starter, too. I have several cameras including Nikon, Canon, and Olympus, but I think this little one is going to be in my pocket when I travel. it's really a handy camera to take pretty decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Let's give it a 4.
Reviews.Author: Ms. S. Brown
Reviews.Content: as much as I love this little camera (my choice was pink), I have to be realistic and give it about a 4.  You can't expect a high end camera for this price.  That said, the novelty is in the size.  It is so cute I'm still "tickled" over it.  I've only taken a few indoor shots and I have learned one thing...set the FILL-IN FLASH.  You do that, your pictures will be terrific.  I haven't tried it outdoors, nor have I tried the video mode.  I like that it has 8gb of internal memory, so I don't have to worry about a card.  (Those pesky little things are easy to lose, misplace, etc...) and an internal battery that can be charged via usb on the pc, or the outlet.  I like shooting in the b/w and sepia modes, too.  For the price paid, 129.00, I don't think you can go wrong.  Now, if you have exceptionally large hands or tend to be all thumbs then I don't think this would be the camera for you.  Sorry about that, cuz it's SUPER COOL.  :)

Reviews.Title: Handy size
Reviews.Author: paul miller
Reviews.Content: I have a full feature SLR and I wouldn't compare the two,  they both have their place.  I wanted it because it's really easy to have on hand all the time.  The best camera for any shot is the one you have with you.  It takes good pictures and movies.  Low light indoor might br a little dark but nearly any photo software can fix that.  Takes a lot better pictures than most phones.  I love having it with me

Reviews.Title: Nikon S01 iPad Problem
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This review is more about how disappointed I was that the S01 doesn't directly connect to the iPad using the Apple iPad Camera Connection Kit (MC531ZM/A). I did however (via YouTube) find you can get it to work by adding a 4 port usb adapter. It's not the sleek flawless set up I was hoping for seeing as how this camera will be a gift for my mother who has technical difficulties. On this detail I wanted to give the camera 1 star but I don't think that would acurately describe the camera itself.As far as the actual camera. I like it for my 70 year old mother with its simple buttons and basic options. I think she will be excited about the size being able to stash it easily in her hand bag. It seems to struggle a big in low light and may be slow for fast action but for what it is I am very happy with the few experimental pictures I have taken.This review may be pre mature but the main motivation was to warn holiday shoppers who are planning to use the S01 with an iPad that there will be some snags.

Reviews.Title: This is the camera you'll be traveling with
Reviews.Author: Christopher Higbee "Crossfire143"
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon 7000 and a D300, with lots of lenses and a high dollar flash. When I shoot a wedding or am in a great place to take photographs, I take one or both of them. For the rest of the time, I have this tiny 10 mp camera with me. It's so light you don't even notice it in a jacket pocket. This takes good videos as well. Could the zoom be longer? Sure. Would I have liked to be able to add a SD card? Sure. But the memory included is acceptable, allowing for ....well, I haven't filled it up yet. This camera is well built and ready to take on your 'daily' adventures. You'll be surprised how much out there is photo worthy. And Note: This is superior to any phone camera, and I've never been happy with my ipad camera. Pick one up, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: TOO MUCH SHUTTER LAG
Reviews.Author: Howard Goodman "Hgeep"
Reviews.Content: It's a cute little camera and it takes acceptable photos.  But, it has quite a lot of shutter lag and so the best ones get away.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is so small that it's hard not to think of it as a toy, and it's cheap too compared to my DSLR.  I have no complaints about the pictures, and I can carry the camera in my pockets.  It is perfect for those times I don't want to carry my camera case, filters, lens, and DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad At All.
Reviews.Author: A. Tay "Private Tay"
Reviews.Content: Like the Nikon's small size and I've had others in the past.SONY used to do one - the one with the rotating lens, was great but took AAA cells, which somehow died fast and the screen was small. Can't remember what happened to it. I tried selling it 2nd-hand but think he LCD died on me.Got various other gimmicky cameras but they have no LCD, which I don;t like.Got a Minox. It's very nice. If you shoot without attaching the flash, then you also lose the LCD.Coolpix SO1 +:Small sizeFairly decent shotsDisplays shutter speed and f-stop (but no control over them)Coolpix SO1 -:Hate touch screen - nothing happens when I press the flash sign on screen bottom left(So have to hit the home button)Hate that there's no flash-off memory, so every time I turn it on again, I have to re-set the flashNo ISO, WB controlDelete button hard to findBUT still a good small cameraTo all the people who love shooting with smartphones, try this: the EV+/- is goodAnd it has optical zoom

Reviews.Title: Poor performance and photo quality
Reviews.Author: Corporal
Reviews.Content: This Nikon has greater picture resolution than my Kodak P712 camera, but has poor picture quality.The good: it fits in my coin pocket.  It has some nice, built-in special effects, built-in storage holds 3,000 photos.The bad: the lower left corner of the touch screen randomly stops working.  At those times I'm unable to change the flash settings.  Poor picture quality.  Camera is very slow.  I frequently miss the shot I want because the camera is not ready to take it.

Reviews.Title: Great news for left handed
Reviews.Author: Tokio K. Ohska
Reviews.Content: I know a nice young lady whose right hand is disabled and left hand is the only hand she can make use of.  She was hoping to be able to enjoy taking pictures like any other girls. All the digital cameras have shutter button on the right end. If she tries to use her left hand, her finger cannot reach the shutter button without obstructing good portion of the viewing screen. Nikon S01 is the only camera her finger can reach the shutter button without obstructing the viewing screen. So, this is the best camera in the whole world for her. I hope this comment will motivate digital camera manufacturers to think about people who has only left hand.  It can be a camera with shutter buttons on both the right and the left side of the camera such as Fuji once made as a film camera. Come on, at least 10% of humans are left handed.  Be considerate. T.K.OHSKA

Reviews.Title: cute & tiny camera
Reviews.Author: BukoBoy
Reviews.Content: It uses an internal memory which means I don't get to take as many photos with it, but I didn't buy it or my "work horse" camera. I use a DSLR for that. The camera is really small. It's the smallest one I have. I clip it to my backpack. It takes decent photos. It is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Surprised by the poor quality of pictures
Reviews.Author: Heath Schoenfeld
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas, and was excited to have her open it. She has an older Canon Elph that is small, yet bulky (square, sharp edges) and I usually have to hold it when we go out places. This camera is very small and a perfect size for going out and taking on vacation for on the go photos of the kids.With that said, the picture quality is really poor. I've taken about 50 pictures since we got it... both in and out, low light and bright, and I'm just amazed at how bad the pictures turn out. It automatically selects a setting based on what it thinks you're taking a picture of, and rarely throws a flash. Too many blurred, orange/yellow tinted pictures... or just plain dark.It's going back this week. Which is a shame because it's really the perfect sized camera for on the go candid shots... it just doesn't take 'em very well!

Reviews.Title: Handiest Camera I have! Until it broke.
Reviews.Author: M. Domingue
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this camera for me at Christmas time. I have had so much fun using this camera! I especially love the fact that it fits in my VERY small purse and I carry it everywhere I go. I am a bit of a camera snob and am very picky about what brand of camera I use as well as the quality. I found that this camera is really nice quality for the price and the fact that I didn't have to purchase a separate memory card is excellent! I have used this camera for photography as well as taking videos with it. The videos come out really clear and it is easy to use. I also love the quality of the pictures. The one issue that I do have with this camera is the flash, this often times makes the picture washed out unless you set it on fill flash. This however is not a deal breaker for me as I don't do a lot of flash photography!Update: Shortly after I wrote this review my camera developed a problem with the lens. The shutter would stick and this problem also made it so the lens would not open. I also started having a problem with the battery not charging, even though I would leave plugged in for several hours. I ended up returning this camera to Nikon to be repaired under warranty. After waiting for three weeks to hear back from them I was given a credit for replacement through the store my husband purchased it from. I did not get the same camera with the credit due to the issues that this one had.

Reviews.Title: It's the best thing that Nikon came out with! Too CUTE!
Reviews.Author: Janela Vargas
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and always seem to misplace or lose my cameras. This one just fits in my pocket and done with.

Reviews.Title: So close to perfection!
Reviews.Author: michael d collier
Reviews.Content: As you may have gathered by now, this camera is really tiny. So small, that when you take it out of your pocket, strangers will approach you and comment. Its build is sturdy and the features and functionality are about what you'd expect when the primary goal is to be super-compact.Here's my nit. The USB cable has a proprietary connector on the camera end. Consider this. I suspect that many people, like me, bought this camera for its portability. That said, if you travel with the camera, you better make sure you take the proprietary cable. Why didn't they use a standard mini USB connector? That way, in a pinch, you could always borrow one or, as a last resort, buy one. You don't have to pack a special charger as the USB cable charges the camera. The storage is built-in. Very portable, but the cable flies in the face of the entire mission of this camera.That said, I love the camera and do carry it with me everywhere. While I would not recommend this as your primary camera, it is a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: Prepare to be disappointed
Reviews.Author: 80's Rocked!
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife as a present. She had wanted it due to the small size. The camera is very small and relatively easy to use. However the compromises the designers made in order to achieve the small size make the camera worthless.In order to achieve the small size the camera has about 7 gigs of non-removable memory. This is okay except for the fact that it does not use a standard micro USB cable. You have to have the special Sony USB cable so that is one more cable to carry around.In order to achieve decent battery life from a very small battery, they compromised on the power of the flash and how often it is used. In many instances where a regular camera would use auto flash, this camera does not. This saves battery life but gives you a lot of blurry images. My wife took the camera to work and almost every picture of her co-workers was blurry.When the flash does go off because it is not very bright it only lights up the area within a few feet of the camera. Taking a picture at a restaurant table, the two people at the front look normal and the people at the back (and everything else) was had a strong orange tint.So the camera is great for shooting images of things that do not move in bright areas. Anything else you'll be better off to use your cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Totally disappointed!!
Reviews.Author: Vitt
Reviews.Content: Very small yes, but very very poor!! Impossible to shoot at night, the flash is useless... I really regret buying this camera!!

Reviews.Title: awesom!
Reviews.Author: Dianna Wolfe "gypsy witch"
Reviews.Content: This is one fabulous little camera. some people have called it a toy. It takes beautiful pictures. I can carry it in my purse and always have a camera at my fingertips. It has many features that my 'big' camera has but not the weight or the bulk. The battery is exceptional. I have had this for months, use it often and have a full charge.

Reviews.Title: Cute, with some potential disadvantages
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a very cute, very small camera that took acceptable pictures on my daughter's trip to Europe.  Our only issue was that there aren't batteries or external storage for the pictures.  She lost the USB cord in Germany, and since that is the only way you power the camera, she couldn't take pictures for the last few days of her trip.  And since the camera doesn't have external photo storage, we couldn't see or download the pictures either.  It was easy to order a cord (cost about $5 online), and we got her camera powered and downloaded her pictures.  The pictures themselves are fine, though the motion shots on the bus are blurry.  But she was able to take some video as well and that turned out good, too.Overall, it is a good little camera for everyday use, just don't lose the cord or have a spare.

Reviews.Title: fantastic!!!!
Reviews.Author: jean erwin
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my immediate usage, readily available at all times....not bulky or inconvientGoing to order the case so i can carry it on my keychain.  PERFECT...HAPPY FACE

Reviews.Title: Cute and compact.
Reviews.Author: Jane Cheng Tucker
Reviews.Content: This little gem fits in a small pocket so it goes everywhere you do. I like the red so it never gets lost in a purse. I prefer the backlight setting on this camera in low light conditions. It makes a great gift!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: MJO
Reviews.Content: THE smallest camera Nikon makes, so I thought it would be decent, as it is.  You won't get SLR quality but it does have 10MP & some control of features;  and also SCENE modes.  It can fit about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S01
Reviews.Author: bkreview
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers noted this little camera is great and does everything well. But it appears to me that none of them actually took the camera outside, into the bright daylight. I bought it the day we left for our Caribbean cruise. Documenting our trip in the airport, on the plane and inside the ship went great. Then I went out on the ship deck to take pictures of the port. I turn the camera on and see nothing on the display, I took off my polarized sunglasses and still nothing. I go back inside and I can see the display again. The problem is that the display is not bright enough to be seen outside. I checked every setting and found no brightness control. So my conclusion is that it is a great camera as long as you stay indoors and useless outside unless it is cloudy.

Reviews.Title: Small, cute, very slow and hard to use with focus and face recognition problems
Reviews.Author: Dragon Speak "goldragn"
Reviews.Content: Nikon missed badly with this oneThis is nothing more than a small disposable camera which should be selling for 30 dollars - or less -  Nikon branded or not; and it just does not work well.I am a Nikon fan, and for small cameras I often chose the COOLPIX line.It is really not that much smaller than my Nikon S51 or S52, both of which are old but highly satisfactory,  however the lack of performance and malfunctions on this S01 is very disappointing.It is going back to where it came from.Focusing is hard and slow if it works at all.It may take many tries to get a green focus signal, and even so, it does not focus half the time.That alone kills it for me. A hard to use point and shoot ? No way.The scroll menu functions tend to be much too sensitive and will scroll quickly past what I want, it is fidgety and hard to select function, that is a major nuisance.The battery and memory (7.3 gigs) is internal and not removable or replaceable.Shooting speed cannot be selected, and automatically sets it itself between ISO 80 to 1600.All that would be fine if it worked.Unfortunately 1/30 speed and slower pictures are common and with the focusing problems mean very poor pictures.There is no white balance adjustment or macro setting.I did found a hidden macro function, so limited that it too is almost non existent.The face recognition is primitive and thinks anything round is a face.More often it misses the human face. Face recognition that malfunctions is worse than no face recognition at all, and you cannot turn this function off.All in all, of all the small Nikons I have owned, this one the worst:It is not really a usable camera.People will buy it because it is near matchbook size and cute, but if they ever used other COOLPIX line cameras, they will be disappointed.The nuisance factor is very high, and it is hard to use with very poor picture results.Three thumbs down for this one.Highly Not recommended

Reviews.Title: Blurry
Reviews.Author: Tracy NN
Reviews.Content: Did not take clear pictures, shutter speed is very slow.  Phone cameras are much clearer and better.  Complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Find a better camera
Reviews.Author: Ron L. Hilton
Reviews.Content: I'm not very impressed with this camera and would not recommend it.  Low light photos are grainy and action shots are blurry. Shutter lag is a big problem.  Would probably be ok for portraits but not landscapes.

Reviews.Title: It's a sub-$100 basic camera
Reviews.Author: sarvdan
Reviews.Content: Lets face it, this camera is not intended for the avid photographer who needs a large zoom with different shutter speeds, etc.  If that is what you need, then consider a nice SLR for hundreds or even thousands of dollars.  This camera is sub-$100.  It is incredibly small, sleek, and comes in a variety of colors.  Is has everything totally internal.  I find this kinda nice.  No battery door to open and battery to slide out.  No memory card slot.  No A/V port.  There is just one small door on the bottom the pops open and utilizes the supplied micro USB charger that a lot of stuff seem to use these days.  When you plug it in, there is a red LED on the top that blinks while charging.  When it stops blinking, it's done charging.  Very simple.  There are only four buttons on the camera and all on top.  It has a small on/off button with the LED in the middle of it, a zoom button around the shutter button, and a picture review button.  The on-screen options are very, very simplified.  The 3x zoom is obviously minimal and the LCD is grainy.  But what do you expect for the price?  The 10 megapixels and about 7GB of internal memory allows a few thousand pictures.  I have not downloaded the pictures to my computer yet as I don't have one yet, so I cannot comment on the actual picture quality.You are probably saying, "My phone has a nice camera so why do I need this?"  The simple answer is, you don't.  Why do we need a lot of things?  We don't.  I bought the silver version solely on looks.  It is more of a chrome/mirrored finish than flat silver.  It looks nice.  My girlfriend saw the pink one and said she liked that one.  Possible gift??The bottom line is that this inexpensive, sleek, incredibly small camera is something you will probably pick up to supplement your phone camera or if you don't want to clog your phone's memory with pictures and videos.  That, or you will probably buy it just because it's cool and you just want it.

Reviews.Title: NOT drag-and-drop, poor ease of retrieving images
Reviews.Author: Bandwidow
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this coolpix, which is so small, and takes pretty good photos. However, my frustration level rises when I want to move the pictures onto my computer. The camera, which does not have a removable memory device, does not show up on the desktop of a computer as a device when plugged in via USB. Instead, you have to download the Nikon viewing software in order to access your images. I contacted Nikon to ask if there was a way to drag-and-drop and their very impersonal answer (at least they DID answer) was to use their "Nikon Image Space" cloud uploader/viewer. I registered for this, and then could never get it to work. I have not yet been able to upload images, or to install the proprietary software that's supposed to make uploading images easier. In this day and age, it should not be this complicated to moved images from your camera onto your computer.

Reviews.Title: Whoa! Tiny!
Reviews.Author: donttellmewhat2do
Reviews.Content: I knew this camera was small, but was not expecting HOW small. It is truly miniscule! (Very cute by the way). I was pleased by the picture and video quality. The quality certainly isn't EXCELLENT, but better than you might expect from a toy-sized camera. Considering I paid under a hundred dollars for it, I am very content. Really my only complaint is very minor. The touch screen is a little (and I mean just barely) unresponsive. It's hardly a big issue, though. I also might add that the flash is not phenomenal, and the zoom is only a little better than a cell phone camera zoom, but both work well enough. (Tip: get within a few feet of subject if taking a picture in a dark setting). This camera would be fantastic for fast pictures. You would just carry this camera in one of your very small pockets and whip it out whenever you want a picture of something but don't want to drag out your nice camera (a Nikon L810 in my case). It would be ideal for trips/traveling. Overall, I would recommend this for someone who is going on a trip, or just wants a small everyday camera IN ADDITION to a nicer one. Again, the camera is ADORABLE!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Afoke Nwankwo
Reviews.Content: This camera is lovely. I couldn't stop holding it as soon as it arrived. It came on time too. Little but mighty camera. The production is as good as the camera. I can't stop loving it.

Reviews.Title: Little camera
Reviews.Author: Alesia Lipe
Reviews.Content: this camera is perfect. Easy to use, takes great pictures and is very easy to transfer your pictures to your computer. So small it fits in my little pack I take on vacation or my pocket. I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Cool pix so 1
Reviews.Author: Shelley
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my 9 year old who loves to take pics she loves her new camera. Tx so much I would buy another any day

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Denise McCrossin
Reviews.Content: Great camera to travel with.  It just slips into your pocket .  The screen is very sensitive so ifyou touch it while the camera is on it will take a picture.  Once you get used to that it's nobig deal.

Reviews.Title: Better outdoors
Reviews.Author: Anthony Cipriano
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this camera is it's small size.  It's very easy to carry around so that you don't miss a great shot that might present itself.  It's a little tricky to navigate, so I'm just using it for basic pictures so far.  My main complaint is that indoor pictures are often not very good quality.  When I'm prepared and want a great picture, I use my Nikon DSLR,

Reviews.Title: Small but Mighty!
Reviews.Author: Laura Kiedaisch
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal pocket camera. Excellent picture quality and video. Large file size must be reduced before sending via email. Good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT!!!
Reviews.Author: Patricia R Jennings
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughter who is a realtor.  This is perfect for her small but great pictures.  Easy to carry and provides the best photos. I would recommend this for anyone who needs a great picture but less camera.

Reviews.Title: Small and cute, but. . .
Reviews.Author: Gaba Hey "Gaba Hey"
Reviews.Content: If you don't care too much about the quality, and just want a few snapshots of your friends and family at a gathering, use your Smartphone.  I have taken over 200 pictures with the S01, on all the different modes.  I wasn't expecting much from such a tiny camera, but I did expect it to take better pictures than my iPhone 4S.  Sorry to say, it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: My best
Reviews.Author: fiddlesticks
Reviews.Content: My best little pocket camera I own but also the only one, I'm pleased with the quality of the photos it takes (not as good as my P100 or P50) but considering the small size and price they are very good, user friendly, great looking and feel, easily fits in my shirt pocket, I do have a problem opening the access cover to the usb connection.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Hiromi Kumamaru
Reviews.Content: This camera is very small and so I can carry anytime in my pocket. I love this nice camera !

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Mr C
Reviews.Content: With everyone carrying a smart phone you may think this is not something you need. However, when you are traveling this is a pleasant alternative. It is small, easy to carry and use. For the money why not have it?

Reviews.Title: It worked for 3 pics and locked up
Reviews.Author: Rick Lovan
Reviews.Content: The Coolpix was the right size but didn't work after taking 3 picks. I called Nikon help line and they were oblivious to the problem although there were questions about the same problem on the internet.

Reviews.Title: Its small
Reviews.Author: Emanuel B. Parad "Manny monoxide"
Reviews.Content: Its okay the best part about it is that its small. Very slow at taking pictures one after another. Poor pictures in low light .

Reviews.Title: great small camera
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The camera was everything I was looking for, small and touch screen. I just wish wireless was built in it to share pictures on the fly.

Reviews.Title: A Novelty Best Avoided
Reviews.Author: Kamal Alyousef
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the S01 on an impulse for no reason other than its size. After the impulse was gone I realized that I was stuck with a cute little camera that would become instantly useless if I were to misplace its proprietary-to-USB cable. I cannot understand why, since Nikon decided against incorporating removable storage or a wireless connection, the only way to extract photos fro the camera is a proprietary connection that requires having the cable with the camera at all times. Why didn't Nikon use the now-ubiquitous Micro-USB instead of something that some people can mistake for Micro-USB? If I could do it again, I would wait for Nikon to address the two issues of removable storage and proprietary connection.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix SO1
Reviews.Author: Anna Banana
Reviews.Content: I love the tiny camera because it fits in the pocket of my jeans.  My last camera was a Coolpix, but when the zoom feature quit working, I wanted a new one.  I'm still getting used to the touch screen.  This camera is very automatic, and the pictures look good on the computer screen despite my using the lowest resolution.

Reviews.Title: No crop function or date imprint!
Reviews.Author: Heather S.
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera since Dec 2012 and like the small size and I do get plenty of comments about it when I take a picture with it("how cute!"), BUT, two features that seem very basic to any digital camera, the crop function and the ability to have the date imprinted on the pictures, are not available!! What the heck?! I did not realize this when I purchased it, had I known, I would not have.  I also have not been able to figure out how to delete all pictures except one by one (may be just my ignorance)  Have owned other Coolpix camera's and have enjoyed the ease of use and features.  Will be looking for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: my go-to camera!
Reviews.Author: LeendaDLL "leendadll"
Reviews.Content: I jokingly call this my "nostril camera" because it's so small that I could practically hide it in my nose (no, not really). I love it. Super convenient and takes great pictures. I carry it at all times. Barely drag out my dSLR anymore.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Kath&Chloe; "KC"
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this camera gets such bad reviews from some people! For a point and shoot camera, it does well in low light and even with moving objects. Bought this as a second camera to keep in purse for pictures of the baby. So far so good! Much better than iphone quality. Camera is small enough to have with you all the time, even when you're carrying loads of baby gear everywhere. I'm tempted to give it 5 stars but megapixels are low, only 10. Great for the size and price though!

Reviews.Title: Well,
Reviews.Author: Cuenta P. Banamex "rbjstudio dotcom"
Reviews.Content: If you expect this camara to do exactly as a Reflex, com on dont expect that just becouse you see nikon on it!I believe nikon sacrifice settings for size, well done cause i can carry this in all my travels, easy and fits everywhere,Quality is superb almost comparable with my 40dX and way better that my 5px pics on my iphone, realy your comparing any phone camara better that this ? Are you trying to catch a car in motion or what?Certenly i wont try to catch anything in motion with this camara,be blured, i love landscapes and macro,I was very surprised on the quality of the images and macro captures.I own a 40DX, GoPro 3, and this little jewel, also the pics are better than my gopro3(white)Cons:A few more settings would be niceFaster shooter ( you can always get around this)For the buck, realy good...

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera so much
Reviews.Author: Pinkmimosa
Reviews.Content: My mom (camera fanatic and pro photographer) got this for me for a Valentines day gift because every stupid drug store camera in the $100 - $250 range I'd choose would bust or suck on me. I have a growing two year old I need pics and videos of. I don't know how I lived without this little camera. It's so tiny and fun, and needs no batteries. The playback sound is crystal clear. I have the red one. Wish I had one in every color!

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: karen davenport
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It is so cute and fits inside my purse even if I am carrying a small pocketbook.  I like the fact that I could choose the color instead of always having silver or black!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Casey F. LaCasse
Reviews.Content: I love the size of this camera.It's so easy to bring anywhere and it's so simple to use.I'm technically challenged so it's perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Robert Goyden "crash"
Reviews.Content: What's not to like.  Size is perfect for carrying it everywhere.  Photos are sharp, clear and color perfect.  Features are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: FOR THE SIZE
Reviews.Author: QMore
Reviews.Content: Very cute little tiny camera! I bought it for my mom and took it to Vegas! The photos are good if there were enough light! but do not use it if there is not enough light ...

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Vini
Reviews.Content: For me The Nikon S1 is The best câmera in The world. Small, beautiful, modern, easy and a lot of another wonderful things!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Edward Nahass
Reviews.Content: Excelent as expectede from Nikon.  Still getting used to the touch screen.  (never had one on a camera before)  Take very good still pictures.  A little slow reacting to the trigger, but practice will overcome this.  Videos and sound are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Close in concept but no cigar in features
Reviews.Author: HB
Reviews.Content: Still haven't figured out the Macro setting and manual is sketchy at best. Sales personnel are baffled too.Emailed Nikon...no response.Slippery to hold, so they should have placed some gripping material on the outside edgesNo adapter with a tripod mount so slow speed or self portrait is limited.Why...because the flash is weak (because of petite size) and slower speeds means shaking.I like the camera however because of its size; I'm just commenting on the lack of completion by the designers.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: lulu365
Reviews.Content: IT is a small giant for what can be done with it , love the color and the case, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Little Camera
Reviews.Author: RP
Reviews.Content: I love this little Nikon camera. As long as you don't expect it to work like a top of the line camera, and use it withinits limitations, this is one really fun camera. Its only real downside is it Doesn't shoot well in lower light, if you haveadequate light, it's a winner. So as a second camera to backup your main camera, it does a very good job.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly great camera
Reviews.Author: Erin Shephard
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Mom for Christmas and she loves it.  My Mom does not like to read directions and has no patience.  The reviews on Amazon helped me to pick this one.  Takes excellent pictures and it's super easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera for the price, under $100.00
Reviews.Author: Charles Page
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the features & size of the camera, its main advantage is the size, other wize it just a 10 M Pix camera, the picture quality is ok & movies are ok also & you can zoom in & out while taking movies, about what you would expect from a digital camera, its battery life is good, it turn on quick, I would recomend this to anyone who would like a small decent quality camera.

Reviews.Title: nice small camara
Reviews.Author: Robert Stefanic Mery
Reviews.Content: Nice, good photos, small size perfect for taking anywhere.  It does not have SD slot so it has to be connected to download photos.

Reviews.Title: Good (Not Very Good or Great) Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Lottes
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christmas present, so my evaluation is somewhat limited.  However, some substantial weaknesses stand out quickly.1. The camera has internal memory only.  Even though it is a relatively generous 7GB, you can't remove and save memory cards.2. Even though the camera has a USB connector, it is used primarily for charging the battery.  The PC doesn't recognize the camera at all and the printer says "Unrecognized device" when I connect it.  There is software you can download onto your PC, but none for the printer that I know of.3. The battery is not replaceable.  If it fails you're in trouble.  This concerns me since I have an older Coolpix camera (different model) with a replaceable battery that I had to replace after a year.4. The sharpness of the images is not the greatest.The best things about the camera are its small size and its "cool factor."  It is small and lightweight and easily fits into a pocket.  It is also intuitive and easy to use.  When I first opened the box, I was stuck by these positives.  However, all in all, I don't recommend this camera, except possibly as a second or third camera after understanding its weaknesses.

Reviews.Title: cute
Reviews.Author: Justine
Reviews.Content: I know my daughter will love this. It is so tiny and when we tested it out it really takes good pictures. It wont take up so much room in your purse.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera!  Substandard performance!
Reviews.Author: CQ DX
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera, but outdoor photos often come out blurred. Indoor performance is a JOKE. The flash sometimes comes on, but not always when it is needed, and the shutter performance is painstakingly slow as well. By the time the shutter actually works, your desired shot is long missed! I almost threw this camera against the wall in utter frustration when attempting to get some key shots at a birthday party! One would expect a lot more from a name like Nikon!

Reviews.Title: it was great...until the last couple of days
Reviews.Author: Kimba
Reviews.Content: so the exclamation point came on...took me forever to figure out it meant that the battery was exhausted---yet the battery icon was showing full.  plugged it in to recharge yesterday and it worked last night.  then this morning it wouldn't do anything---little exclamation point on again and yet the battery icon was full.  so i plugged it in and went to work. just got home...turned it on ... it kept saying (and it did this yesterday) that the card wasn't formatted.  so today i was so frustrated that i couldn't make it do anything, i told it to reformat...and of course lost all the pics from the dinner party last night, AND it still won't work---even less so than before.  i turn it off and back on and it says the card isn't formatted.  whether i reformat it or click cancel, the damn thing will not work---that circle exclamation point comes on.  i remember reading at the beginning if there's a problem NOT to send it back to where it came from but of course now i can't find where i should send it or who i should call...so i'm still looking. not to mention i fell for the "insurance" thingy that i betcha won't matter a hill of beans.  when the thing was working it was great fun! and the pictures were beautiful and i thought it was easy to use.  NOT ANYMORE! and i've only had it a matter of weeks...not happy.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Carla Pereira
Reviews.Content: Got this as a birthday present, and fell in love with it right away.  It's super compact, the touchscreen is sensitive but not annoyingly so, and it takes great pictures.  Still experimenting with getting the best out of low-light photography, but for around the house with family, on trips with friends, etc it's fantastic.  Battery life seems to be good, but I've only had it a month, so we'll see how it holds up over time.  So tiny you can carry it in your pocket!

Reviews.Title: Amazing for its size!
Reviews.Author: Joe A.
Reviews.Content: Great camera for its tiny size and really functional! A must buy, you won't regret it! Nikon Cool pix (pink)

Reviews.Title: Great new Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: abernacf
Reviews.Content: The Nikon CoolPix SO1 is one nice little camera. It is easy to use and takes both stills and video! If you are looking for a small camera to carry in pocket or purse this is the one! Great pictures the camera is a quality product and would purchase again!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Debora Klepper
Reviews.Content: Camera was bought for nine yr (who takes care of items) the size is small so it makes it very easy to hold. We liked the pics and video, very easy for him to operate over all great buy!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix so1
Reviews.Author: Sweet T
Reviews.Content: I thought this camera was going to be a let down but it is the best. If need something small I say get this one. The best.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Britt808
Reviews.Content: I was excited to purchase this item because it was very cute, perfect compact size, touch screen and has built in memory. But i am very dissappointed by its poor picture quality. I tried to take pics of my sons Christmas performance under a pavilion but the pictures came out dark :(. Even the video was really bad and the zoom was horrible! I did try different settings but nothing worked :(.I also tried taking pics in the house and it came out orangeish and dark. I wish this camera took better pics cause i really liked it :(...So if you want something fun and different but dont care about the picture quality than this camera is for you, but its NOT worth the price. But if you want good pictures i suggest you do your research. Im currently looking into a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Camera NEVER worked!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "darth random"
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift and still months later, can't get this camera to work. I've done research online its an OS issue, that Nikon won't acknowledge, so therefore i can't send it back under warranty. Very disappointed!! I know this non working camera and the poor customer service have made up my mind to where i won't ever purchase a Nikon camera! So disappointed just wanted to small easy camera and all i got was a  small paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Worst Nikon Ever
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan
Reviews.Content: I have other Nikon cameras and thought that this would be a good one to have in my purse. I am very disappointed as it is very poor with any moving images, my photos of a parade were all smears. It is terrible in low light, my cellphone camera is actually better. It takes too long to snap a photo so you miss what you were aiming at and takes too long between photos. Also the zoom should be more than 3x. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a good camera
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: The camera is a decent one, and its size is perfect. The touch panel is great for view the photos and pass them.

Reviews.Title: Crevice of doom! (kind of)
Reviews.Author: Sean Lee
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera. I'm getting a lot of compliments for how small and compact it is. It powers up fast, I don't have to worry about memory cards or battery chargers and what not. The only downside to this camera (personal opinion of course) are the crevices on the sides of the screen. I didn't notice them at first and now I wish I hadn't noticed them. It's a white camera and there are noticeable black crevices on all four sides of the touch screen. Dust and debris can easily get caught in there and.. well.. the camera's white. It's going to bother me forever, but it doesn't seem like the touch screen is made to have a perfect fit with the white body.Thus.. 4 out of 5

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: P. Yang
Reviews.Content: It's great for quick snapshots.  If you are looking for a high quality camera then maybe look elsewhere.For me I just to quick shots here with friends and backgrounds.  I'm not really a photographer, but more of a snap shooter.  For me it's perfect because I can just stick it in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Total kit with the kid.
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Goodpenny
Reviews.Content: These little cameras are about the best thing for a kid or for dropping in your pocket on a little sight-seeing. I prefer photos on this to a smart phone, because of privacy concerns.

Reviews.Title: Was good until it broke
Reviews.Author: Cassie
Reviews.Content: I used it for a month or two, nice quality pictures and very portable. Then I took it to Tokyo with me and somewhere on the way there the touch screen cracked. It still works but you cant see anything on the screen which makes it pointless. Be Warned it is fragile, I had it in my purse, in a case on the plane in the cabin with me the whole time. Disappointed that I wasted the money on it

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Denis Zubovic
Reviews.Content: It was a present for a 11-year old and it exceeded her/our expectations. It has a touch screen and editing capabilities so you can make small movies and clips.

Reviews.Title: Handy Camera
Reviews.Author: GELLMD "SF Customer"
Reviews.Content: Love this handy camera ...gave this as Christmas gifts and the ones who i gave itto asked me to buy more for them to give as gifts. Reasonable price...good buy!

Reviews.Title: A snazzy and very powerful little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Treehugger
Reviews.Content: I bought mine factory refurbished for $46.00.  There are more recent versions,which is the reason the SO1 is inexpensive.  It takes still pictures of good quality with 10mp resolution comparable to an older SLR.  Other reviews have described its virtues  well, so I won't repeat that here.  It is very easy to use and super portable.  It has surprising versatility for a small point-and-shoot.I recommend using a plastic screen protector (less that $3.00) and keeping the camera in a leather case (mine was $3.00 new) so the camera doesn't become scratched in your pocket.The only things I don't particularly like are that it does not use removable memory cards. It holds about 300 still pictures and downloads directly to a computer or other USB device with a supplied cable. The rechargeable battery is  integrated into the camera  and not removable for the average user.

Reviews.Title: cute but touch screen not very sensitive
Reviews.Author: alejandra bibbo
Reviews.Content: i end uo selling it it was cute but not the best quality the best thin it was the color!! lol

Reviews.Title: Sleek and stylish
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Great camera for anyone wanting more than a camera on their phone. Very easy to carry around and I found it very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Dark Red and Easy To Identify as Yours
Reviews.Author: BAMoilan
Reviews.Content: Purchased for use in Liberia West Africa where things, all things, grow legs and walk away.  I still have the camera, because it is easy to identify as mine.  The color Red is great for me and the camera works well.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Flavia
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA. IS VERY EASY TO USE. THE PRICE IS PERFECT AND THE COLOR IS AWESOME. IT IS PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S01 10.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Zoom NIKKOR Glass Lens...
Reviews.Author: fritzan
Reviews.Content: I trusted the Nikon brand name, and so far it's doing fine.Before even trying to use the camera, I read the basic instructions in the little guide book.  And, as the days went by, I read more advanced ones. Thus, slowly but surely I am learning to master as much as possible the Nikon electronic tool that I've recently bought. A word of advice is these two extremes are wrong: 1. trying to use a product without reading any of the instructions that come with it; 2. trying to read the whole guide in order to know everything at once.No, the trick seems to be: a bit of theory followed by a bit of practice.Then you advance further.  But,  overall, as Chairman Mao Tse Tung :-) once wrote:  "No theory without practice, and no practice without theory !"  :-)  —  FRITZ

Reviews.Title: Completely Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful simply adorable little camera. It takes excellent point and shoot pictures and everyone compliments the size and colour. Easy to learn and touch screen features where also brilliant.

Reviews.Title: So1 and Leather case with strap
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Jeanne Phipers
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera and the adorable case that goes with it.  THe problem is that my dogs love it too - no matter where I try to hide it, they find it!

Reviews.Title: Very Very Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Alexis La'wynn Ryals
Reviews.Content: I've always had a thing for smaller things so when I saw this camera, I knew I had to have it. Was very excited when I received this camera until I took it for a test run. The pictures are very grainy and trying to take a indoor picture is a lost cause. The photos give off an orange/yellow tint even in a well lit room. Needless to say, this camera was returned the next day.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix S01
Reviews.Author: J. Luse "Chaka1211"
Reviews.Content: Camera came in original packaging. It came quickly.  The camera is easy to use. It takes clear pictures. Easy to pop into your pocket or purse. Have not printed any pics yet.

Reviews.Title: The coolest camera in the world.  I carry mine in my pocket everywhere and usually forget that it is even there.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Harper "Engaged Citizen"
Reviews.Content: No brainer, great pictures, you will want to eat the camera it is solo luscious. Get and matching case and strap. Yum

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: francine Jennings
Reviews.Content: EVERYONE IS AMAZED AT ITS SIZE AND HOW WELL THE PICTURES ARE DETAILED. LOVED GETTING THE CASE WITH IT AS AT REGULAR RETAIL IT WAS EXTRA

Reviews.Title: Cute, functional, really small
Reviews.Author: Kamuela
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I think Nikon makes some things just to show they can. This is one of them. OK, it'll never replace a real camera, but the best camera is the one in your hand, and this one makes that easy. It just showed up, I spent the last several hours fiddling with it, and i'm actually pretty happy.It is really tiny; let's get that out of the way first. You can't believe how small. It really is about the size of a credit card, but about ¾" thick, weighs nothing, almost fits in a watch pocket and for sure in any other pocket, inside a hat brim....  really small. Thus, it meets my first requirement, being in my hand when I want it. I'm not about to carry a big and/or expensive camera everyplace, this one will work fine for a "just in case".  Like American Express, don't leave home without it. Or Visa, it's everywhere I want to be. Somehow it inspires credit card jokes.Quality-wise, not so much. It's OK, a bit noisy especially at high iso, but adequate. Not the tool for high resolution, big prints. Perfectly fine for small prints, anything where a bit of graininess is OK. Or, for that matter, where no other camera is readily available, which is where it shines. In fact, in black and white mode, the graininess looks pretty good. There's a bit of chromatic aberration and distortion at the frame edges, too. I give i a 7/10 for image quality. Much better than any cell phone camera, though; and better than cheap point-and-shoots with plastic lenses.There's not a lot of manual control options. Actually, aside from zoom, none. Well, there is exposure compensation, +- 2 EV, which is something. It does what it does and you're not necessary for that. Point, push the button. DO turn off the touch-screen-to-trip-shutter function; it just begs for jiggle.Internal storage for about 3000 frames at highest resolution is fine. Internal battery is fine, but I suspect it won't last more than a few years because of short charging cycles. That's OK, I'll make an effort to do a deep discharge once in a while.The little place where the (standard mini USB; not proprietary at all) connector plugs in is a bit of a trick; you need to catch the slot with a fingernail and flip it up and sideways. I wish the instructions were a little clearer on that. it's held by a rubber plug, just bends out of the way. Probably the only cheesy-feeling thing on the whole camera. otherwise it feels like a quality piece of machinery; nice, dense feel, great finish, just what we expect from Nikon. The chrome finish, by the way, is a knockout.  Once plugged in via the cord, iPhoto or Aperture find the camera for download just fine; no special software needed.I'm giving it a 4/5 because the image quality could be better (not sure how, though, with this dinky sensor. The optics are pretty decent for their size) and I'd like some manual something.Well worth the modest cost if you really feel the need to have a camera in reach at all times. I plan to keep it under my pillow.

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor, but awful indoor pictures....I lost some  of my most precious Christmas photos!
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ
Reviews.Content: Though this camera fits in your pocket, don't take indoor pictures, as they will all be VERY blurry.  Had I known this, I would never have bought this camera.  I cannot re-take the moments lost!  I plan on writing to the company and hop Nikon will send me a tiny camera that takes as good a picture as an IPhone!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: This little beauty is the perfect size for travelers because it is easy fitting in a pocket of purse and it works great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: wesley wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my fiancé for Christmas. When I got it couldn't believe how small it was. She absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift!
Reviews.Author: JENNIFER GARCIA
Reviews.Content: Was a wonderful gift. Great quality pictures. Bought it a lear ago, and it's come in very handy during holidays especially. Small enough to carry around all night.

Reviews.Title: Great tiny camera to carry!
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Puckett
Reviews.Content: So small and handy to carry anytime in your shirt pocket .Takes good photos! Hope Nikon keeps making this! Highly recommended for its reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Melvey "Rick F"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little pocket camera and is easy to carry in any pocket or purse. Takes pretty good pictures  for a miniature camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Priscilla Strasser
Reviews.Content: perfect size to fit in your pocket. We will always have a camera on us now, even when we don't wanna pull out the big one!!

Reviews.Title: The camera was not new as they said
Reviews.Author: Pam Rayborn
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this company. When I got the camera the box was very dirty and looked used. I contacted amazon and they'd refunded me some credit as the company said it must have been how amazon stored it. Not true. It was a Christmas present and the camera looked ok in the package so I kept it for the gift.amazon said they'd had no more. The I gave the company three stars at  first. When my daughter got it for Christmas we had to laugh because it was charged already and had pictures of Ramon people on it. Mostly target people I. A store. I was so upset about I. But my daughter said it is ok mom I don't care I love it. I told the company about it and all they wanted to do was give me a refund as they had no more. Their answer was well we don't check all the products we sell as we have too many and please don't give us a bad rating. What I wish I could give no stars. So please be carefully with is company. I hope amazon takes them off.

Reviews.Title: Cool-Pix S01 Silver
Reviews.Author: Ol Mule
Reviews.Content: Great & smallest good camera  I've seen. Works great for my purposes so far. Perfect accessory for my Jeep trips.

Reviews.Title: Cute, but...
Reviews.Author: O. Joy "OJ"
Reviews.Content: Cute as can be, but pictures are so-so.Haven't been able to download program to get them out of cameraIt may be that my laptop won't handle the program.

Reviews.Title: It's an ok product for teens.
Reviews.Author: Rosi
Reviews.Content: I like the size and the color,  but the pictures quality is not so good. It is better for teens than adults.

Reviews.Title: Tiny!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Decent pictures for what you get. But the size is great. I was able to take this all over costa rica when i was horseback riding, atving,ziplining,hiking etc. It was great not to lug my other camera around when we did all that crazy stuff there.

Reviews.Title: Great "little" find!
Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my 8 year old daughter's birthday.  Delivered right on time and she loved it!  Compact and easy to use.  Takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Marbear "Marbear"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera!!! Love it. Really does fit in a pocket. Fun to use, easy to use . Takes great , clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: It's covered on finger prints and has a scratch
Reviews.Author: sharon
Reviews.Content: I received the camera but it is very dirty and it has a scratch on it. Seems like it was a display camera somewhere. I hope that I can get a discount for it because of that. couldn't figure out how to message you.

Reviews.Title: Tiny Nikon
Reviews.Author: Eric Wilder "Eric Wilder"
Reviews.Content: I carry this camera in my shirt pocket. Main drawback is I have large hands and this is a tiny camera. Still, like every Nikon I've ever owned, it takes great pics and is as convenient as it gets.

Reviews.Title: Wow! It's Mini!
Reviews.Author: victorious warrior
Reviews.Content: I saw this camera and just about died! It was 3 of my favorite things- 1. mini 2. pink 3. touch screen!!This camera amazes me because it takes such great photos considering how tiny it is!The video quality and picture quality is amazing. It takes crisp clean photos.It is really easy to download pictures on to your computer from the camera.This camera fits perfectly into your back pocket for easy pictures.The battery life lasts fairly long and takes about 6 hrs to charge.Overall great camera and great price to too!Recommended!!!P.S. The pink is super cute! <3

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me!!
Reviews.Author: Kathy Thie
Reviews.Content: I love my baby camera! It takes great pics & videos! Much better then my camera phone & takes up no room!!! Fits anywhere!!

Reviews.Title: So compact and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: The clarity of the pictures is amazing. The camera is very user friendly.  Quality of photos is excellent.  Although the more maximum zoom does distort the pictures a bit.

Reviews.Title: Small, effortless, and great results.
Reviews.Author: Michael B Pasternack
Reviews.Content: Cell phones don't work where I live and this is the easiest to always have with you camera I've ever had. Easy and great picture or video use without the IPhone costs.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Diana N
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera to fit in your pocket and always have available for every shot. The pictures are very good. The only drawback is you have to download to your computer. I bought this to take on a trip to Italy. It was lightweight and small. I love it.

Reviews.Title: nikon COOlPIX SO1 10.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jean A. Mccormick "Italianquassolo"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes great pictures.  Does not use a memory card it has an internal memory.  I have one in my pocket book, car and an extra one at home.  I am using it all the time.

Reviews.Title: OK for a Kid
Reviews.Author: Culinista "bookandcook"
Reviews.Content: This is the second Nikon COOKPIX S01 we have purchased, so there were no surprises. Same horrible photo quality, but the winning features for our 4-year-old daughter: hot pink color, adorable size for little fingers, and fun features she can navigate. She even figured out on her own how to put on a slideshow to music--I have no idea how to do it. Babysitter allowed baby sister to break the first one, so there was no peace until we replaced it with the exact same model.It is admittedly extravagant to buy a real camera for a preschooler as a birthday present, but it beats her taking our camera all the time and it is interesting to see the world from her point of view. She is recording her own life--the view from the carseat, goings-on at nursery, the underside of chairs and the lower shelves of the supermarket. She has made some really interesting pictures, and I am saving them in a digital album.The major down side was price. The first camera was purchased at Cosco and came complete with matching hot pink  leather carrying strap and case for about half the price we paid for just the camera alone on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Small and sleek!
Reviews.Author: Janis "Programmer | Graphic Designer | Web De...
Reviews.Content: It's a small and fun camera to have. Small and light and still better than the camera on the phone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Thanh Giang
Reviews.Content: Awesome little camera. Perfect size for many hidden or candid shots. Wish it had an SD Card slot though. Overall really good camera. We use it and take it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Baker
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and shoot camera! It fits perfectly in a pocket and is great to take for a night out on the town or as a secondary camera!

Reviews.Title: Handy, Tiny Camera.
Reviews.Author: Gray Horse
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a fabulous pocket camera, look no further.A bargain at the price, people are amazed at the small size, and I'm very pleased at the quality of the photos.  Goes a long time on the (proprietary) battery, no need for a separate SD card, really, this is a take-with-you-all-the-time light and compact camera, no excuse not to have one handy any more.Only thing I miss is the tripod socket--but it does have little feet on the bottom so can be propped up on a level surface when using the self timer.On screen touch controls take a bit of getting used to, and sometimes don't do what you want to immediately, but that's a minor point, and easily fixed with some practice. Nice easy playback, deleting unwanted photos, and scanning what you've taken, all on screen.  Connect to your computer to save the photos with the included USB cable.A great, little camera, from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Quality Photos From A Tiny Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Ary
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for those that don't like or seldom use a digital camera. Why? Because it is fun to use, it is not complicated, it shoots quality photos and it is small enough to keep in a shirt pocket or purse. It is also good for those that already have a larger format camera as their primary use camera, and just want a secondary everyday casual point and shoot camera that is not bulky and can be kept handy in a pocket. This is how I use it. It serves this purpose well for those getting those spontaneous shots that may come up when you don't have your primary camera available.  Don't expect it to capture top notch telephoto images of far off wildlife across a foggy field, or low light images from mountain tops. It just doesn't have the processing power or lens capabilities that larger format cameras possess. But, it most of your shots are "snap shot" type photos of subjects that range from macro distance up to 10 feet away, then this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera , too bad it doesn't work when you want it to
Reviews.Author: J. jones "jmike"
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little camera, and it's a Nikon, But don't let that fool you.I also get the exclamation point with a line through the middle of the screen.And this usually happens when I really want to take a picture, very frustrating.Can't find a software update. It usually happens after I have previewed the stored pictures and disappears after I download the pics from the camera and format the memory.Don't waste your money or fall for cute, yes it's cute but that doesn't help if it's an embarrassment to own.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Hayley McSurley
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. I got this for those times when carrying a large camera is unnecessary. I really enjoy this little guy. Takes pretty good pictures for how small it is and has a nice touch screen!

Reviews.Title: Fun with limits
Reviews.Author: K.G. "Bulldog"
Reviews.Content: limits I bought this for my fiancé as a every day carry purse camera. It is better than nothing but it had a weak flash and a limited focus. For quick snap shots at parties it is great. For its size and price it is fun but it will not be your go to camera. It serves our purpose for it well but I would have been disappointed if I was getting it add my only point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: camer
Reviews.Author: Shirley Schmit
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera.  I get a lot of comments. Very fun.  I now need seven more words.  done

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for Point and shot pics and video
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I like this product because it is The seller offered great customer service.  I wish it shot pictures in Black and white but no big deal.  I am happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Toni hohvart
Reviews.Content: Best little camera. I can take right in my pocket.pictures come out so clear, easy to use. Easy to send pictures thru computer.

Reviews.Title: unbelievably small
Reviews.Author: Sharon A. Meier
Reviews.Content: The camera is unusable in low light conditions. In good light , the camera takes great pics. The camera is intuitive.And, best of all, it's a carry anywhere camera! It's a good buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!!
Reviews.Author: Katrina Gaskin
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera!  It is tiny and very easy to carry around.  It has more features than I expected, like the touch screen shot option and video.  It is perfect to take anywhere and not have to worry about who will carry the camera.  I love this camera.  Keep in mind its a small point and shoot, not a fancy professional camera.  I would buy another one in a minute. Very pleased.  It looks like a James Bond spy camera!!  I LOVE that you recharge the battery instead of replacing them all the time!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix s01
Reviews.Author: JOHN L.I. NY
Reviews.Content: This mini digital camera get lots of attention!I gave this to my wife for her birthday andeverytime we used it in public, ppl alwa\ys asksus about it.  I like the fact that it's easy to useand has touchscreen :)Also, ppl seem to get attracted, due to the small but uniquepackage.

Reviews.Title: u can only get so much using digital zoom for this kind of lens
Reviews.Author: Teri Watson "i am Amazon"
Reviews.Content: touch screen is not as sensitive, you will have to press 5 sec before it moves.even tho it's 10MP, it's still grainy using digital zoom at 15ftwhat else...uhm scene mode is not accessible..its automatic, so you dont have control over it.this is only good for 5 ft kind of snap and shootw/ no lighting challengesremember this is so small, so think vibration, noise and grainyanother coolpix that didnt pass my expectation like CoolpixS3000didnt deliver the performancebut oh hey, i have D90 that i love so muchpls tell me w/c small Nikon would do the jobthx!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: Tk
Reviews.Content: Loved the size! Touch screen not as responsive as I would like. Quality was very poor, even when camera taking pics from flat surface. Sent camera back for refund!

Reviews.Title: Approved
Reviews.Author: Walter Vollers
Reviews.Content: For his size, it is very handful. I can go everywhere I want, even in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Perfect

Reviews.Title: The ideal camera
Reviews.Author: Jodi DeCarlo
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for those moments and memories you don't want to miss!  It fits perfect in your handbag and always ready for the picture.  It is so small,  it fits right in your hand!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: ck
Reviews.Content: This is a really great small camera.  I just took it on a three week vacation and it was easy to use and the pictures turned out great.  There was plenty of space on the internal memory for all my pictures.  And the camera charges easily in the U.S. and Europe.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera
Reviews.Author: Elaypeedee
Reviews.Content: I really didnt know if this little camera would be a good as they say, but for the price i got it for from amazon i couldnt go wrong....Now i take it everywhere i go i love this little camera and so does everyone else.....because of its size it wont be long till i lose it...

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Deborah Hardy
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera a couple of weeks ago, my husband exclaimed, "Not another camera!". But let me tell you, this is just not 'another camera'!It takes excellent photos given that is a relatively cheap point and shoot camera.We just arrived back from eight days vacation in Cancun where I took 292 pics and 4 videos and did not have to charge the camera at all! The size is great and it also was admired by many.Was able to upload all the pics from the camera each evening onto my Mini iPad. To do this you will need a couple of extra accessories, but it is still easy enough to do.The zoom is adequate, not brilliant, but adequate. The flash is only good for close up pics. Also found I had to us the 'fill flash' mode a few times.Tip - you can download the User Manual and read it before you purchase, which is what I did and found it most useful so when I received the camera from Amazon, not only wad the camera fully charged and ready to go, so was I!Photos posted!

Reviews.Title: What a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: G. R. Davis
Reviews.Content: I've never been much of a picture-taker (not photographer), but with this little camera it is so easy carry it around and snap a few pics.Although many people may complain of the lack of removable media and the non-responsive touch screen I think that even taking those criticisms into account this is still a worthwhile purchase for people who want a quick little camera they can take anywhere.It is also a great conversation point whenever you take it out - people are amazed at how small the camera is and everyone wants a chance to play with it.Again, a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: tiny and easy to carry around, takes great pictures too
Reviews.Author: Sandra E. Russell "art detective"
Reviews.Content: I took this little thing on a trip. I tried to "travel light" so this was about as light a camera as I could find..it was really sweet to use too. I could carry it in the palm of my hand, and take quick shots even while walking, and some of those were sharp and clear, much to my surprise. Frankly I haven't read the manual or used all the features and functions of this thing yet.
